alert.note: Alert for Hunt; Rockwall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 6:45PM CST until January 28 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Hunt and Rockwall Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Sabine River near Quinlan. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor out of bank flooding will occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 15.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. This brief minor flood forecast is based on forecasted rainfall and it`s possible minor flood stage may not be achieved. We should know more by Saturday morning with actual rainfall upstream. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
